intro: Andinocleome pilosa, commonly known as the hairy Andinocleome, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate climates and is often found in mountainous areas. Its flowers are small and clustered, producing pale yellow to white blooms that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
